answers.answer: I did, and I ended up having gestational diabetes. A friend went through the same thing, but didn't have gd. If you and up having gd, it is completely controllable. Just follow your doctor or nutritionist's directions. I had a healthy baby boy and didn't end up continuing diabetes after his birth.

I had to take the test twice and I'm not saying your doc is like this but I noticed that every test I had to take I had to take twice cause "something was off" etc. It was just weird and once my doctor told me I had to take that test again because "my levels seemed a little over" so I switched docs and it turned out my levels were fine. Idk if my doc was trying to make my insurance pay more or whatever but she was having me worry over nothing continuously throughout my pregnancy when it turned out I didn't even need the tests done.
Im failed and my doctor told me to not come back for test just control to eat sweet and monitor my sugar level at home. Using glocuse test kit. So now im perfect fine my sugar level is 95 it was 189

Thanks ladies this really is helpful I'm just hoping I'm fine.. I don't even eat sweets an I still work a 8 hour job that keeps me on my feet constantly moving idk what could be going on but I'll update on the 27th after my appointment but my fingers are crossed. Other than that my pregnancy been great!!!
I failed the first time, had to do the 3 hour testing then I passed. Make sure you don't eat anything before hand, it makes a difference fersure.

question: I'm a little sad that I didn't pass my glucose test yesterday now I gotta go back for the 3 hour test I pray that I score in the passing levels come Monday...has anyone else had to take the test twice??
title: glucose test
